Track extent of manpower resources and logistics deployed on faults. 3. Create Redundancies in the distribution network 4. Reduce fault affected areas and isolation time through investment in circuit fusing and sectionalisers. 5. Use contractors where possible on fault repairs 6. Consider using consultants to patrol the network to identify faults and hazards 7. Collate required major maintanance materials needed for prompt resolutions of faults and liaise with stores for regular update on stock levels for an early alert if materials stock fall below the minimum level. If it so happens, follow up to ensure the gap is closed immediately. 8. Effective and timely vegetation control 9. Prompt preparation of invoice for payment of claims of bush clearing contractors 10. Conduct regular routine inspection 11. Create Redundancies in the distribution network
